intro: Fuirena somaliensis, commonly known as the Somali spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Horn of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and yellow-orange flowers. The plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing drought-resistant features. It typically grows as a shrub or a low-growing perennial, often found in rocky or sandy soils. Its botanical structure reflects its ability to thrive in harsh, dry conditions.
